adr.title: Feature: Self-Validating Agents
adr.context: We want agents to be able to run their own mini governance cycles to verify their recommendations before reporting them.
adr.decision: Add a new method ArchitectAgent.auto_verify() that creates an instance of ICGL() and runs it recursively.

consensus_recommendations: Implement a depth limit for recursion to prevent infinite loops
Use a queue or stack to manage iterations instead of recursion
Introduce monitoring and logging mechanisms to track the depth and performance of the governance cycles
all_concerns: Excessive resource consumption and potential memory leaks
Infinite recursion leading to stack overflow
No retry validation defined in proposal
Difficulty in debugging and maintaining recursive governance cycles

agent_results.analysis: Introducing a method that recursively instantiates ICGL within ArchitectAgent.auto_verify() risks creating infinite loops and excessive resource consumption. This design could lead to stack overflow errors and degrade system performance, especially under heavy load.
recommendations: Implement a depth limit for recursion to prevent infinite loops
Use a queue or stack to manage iterations instead of recursion
Introduce monitoring and logging mechanisms to track the depth and performance of the governance cycles
concerns: Infinite recursion leading to stack overflow
Excessive resource consumption and potential memory leaks
Difficulty in debugging and maintaining recursive governance cycles
